revision.comment: Not really a museum ship if not open to the public for a decade
revision.text:
{{Use British English|date=December 2013}} {{Infobox military installation |coordinates = {{coord|51|23|43.7|N|0|30|12.9|E}} }} {{Use dmy dates|date=December 2013}} {|{{Infobox ship begin |display title=Submarine ''U-475 Black Widow''}} {{Infobox ship image |Ship image= [[File:Foxtrot class submarine at Strood.png|300px]] |Ship caption=Soviet Foxtrot-class submarine at Strood in Kent }} {{Infobox ship career |Hide header= |Ship country= Soviet Union |Ship flag={{shipboxflag|Soviet Union|naval}} |Ship name= ''U-475'' ''Black Widow'' |Ship namesake= |Ship ordered= |Ship builder= |Ship laid down= 1966-10-12 |Ship launched= 1966-12-24 |Ship acquired= |Ship commissioned= 1967-06-30 |Ship decommissioned= 1993-06-30 |Ship in service= |Ship out of service= |Ship struck= |Ship reinstated= |Ship homeport= |Ship motto= |Ship nickname= |Ship honours= |Ship fate= |Ship status=Dilapidated state; moored on the [[River Medway]] near [[Rochester, Kent|Rochester]]<ref name="med"/> |Ship notes= }} {{Infobox ship characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship class= {{sclass2-|Foxtrot|submarine}} |Ship displacement=1950 [[Tonne|t]] |Ship length={{convert|92|m|ft|abbr=on}} |Ship beam= {{convert|7.5|m|ft|abbr=on}} |Ship draft= {{convert|5.1|m|ft|abbr=on}} |Ship propulsion=*3 × {{convert|2000|hp|kW|lk=in|abbr=on}} diesel engines *3 electric motors; 2 × {{convert|1350|hp|kW|abbr=on}} and 1 × {{convert|2700|hp|kW|abbr=on}} *1 × {{convert|140|hp|kW|abbr=on}} auxiliary motor |Ship speed= {{convert|16.8|kn|lk=in|abbr=on}} surfaced |Ship range=*{{convert|30,000|nmi|lk=in|abbr=on}} surfaced *{{convert|400|nmi|abbr=on}} submerged |Ship endurance= |Ship test depth={{convert|250|-|280|m|ft|abbr=on}} |Ship complement=77 |Ship sensors= |Ship EW= |Ship armament=*10 [[torpedo tube]]s (6 bow, 4 stern) *Up to 22 torpedoes |Ship armour= |Ship notes= }} |}
'''Submarine ''U-475'' ''Black Widow''''' was a [[Soviet Navy]] [[submarine]] of the [[Cold war]] period, which is now in private hands. She is currently moored at [[Strood]], on the [[River Medway]], in [[South-East England]].
==Background== The Soviet Project 641 class submarines (known to the West by their [[NATO reporting name]] of {{sclass2-|Foxtrot|submarine|5}}) was a [[Ship class|class]] of conventionally powered patrol/attack submarines. Some 74 were built by the [[Soviet Navy]] between 1957 and 1983 as well as 17 others for the Libyan, Cuban and [[Indian Navy|Indian]] Navies.
==Service history== ''Black Widow'' was built at Sudomekh shipyard in [[Leningrad]] and commissioned in 1967. She was based at [[Riga]] and served with the Soviet [[Baltic Fleet]] before being used as a training vessel for crews from overseas who would be operating Foxtrot-class subs in their own navies. She was decommissioned in 1994 and sold.
==Museum ship== After passing into private hands, and under the name "''U-475 Black Widow''" she was moored at Long's Wharf near the [[Thames Barrier]] in England where she was open to the public as a [[museum ship]]. in 1998 she was moved to [[Folkestone]], where she was again opened to the public. In 2004 she was moved to her present location, in a state of disrepair, and is currently awaiting restoration.<ref name="med">[http://medwaylines.com/blackwidowsubmarine.htm "Black Widow"], Medwaylines.com. Retrieved 21 December 2013.</ref><ref name="kent">[http://web.archive.org/web/20120825174441/http://www.undergroundkent.co.uk/russian_submarine.htm "The Russian Submarine U-475 Black Widow, Medway"]. Undergroundkent.co.uk. Retrieved 21 December 2013. (Web archive)</ref>
Located at 51.395495, 0.503651
==Naming== The submarine is currently referred to as "Foxtrot B-39 U-475 Black Widow".<ref name="med"/> The "B-" designation stands for ''Bolshaya'' ("Large"), and was used by the Soviet Navy during the Cold War era, but another [[Soviet submarine B-39|Foxtrot B-39]] also exists, now moored at [[San Diego]] as a museum ship. The "B-39" designation also suggests a vessel in the Soviet Pacific Fleet; Baltic Fleet vessels carried numbers in the 200s. The name “Black Widow” and the designation “U-475” were given to the boat by the new owners; Soviet submarines were not generally named, the "U-" designation was not used by the Soviets, and none of the Foxtrots known carried the number "–475".
In Soviet service she was actually known as B-49 and served in the Northern Fleet until November 1974 when she was reassigned to the Baltic.<ref name="Project 641">[http://russian-ships.info/eng/submarines/project_641.htm "Project 641"], russian-ships.info.com. Retrieved 21 April 2014.]</ref>
